title: What's a song that gives you a feeling you can't explain? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are so many. Handal’s Messiah. Evanescence’s My Immortal. Pat Benatar’s Hell is for Children. Dylan’s All Along the Watchtower. Eric Clapton and Bobby Whitlock’s Layla. Vivaldi’s Four Seasons. Pachabel’s Cannon. Billy Holliday’s Bitter Fruit. Henryk Gorecki’s Symphony No. 3, Op. 36, "Symfonia piesni zalosnych" (Symphony of Sorrowful Songs): II. Disturbed's The Sound of Silence. On a brighter note: Jessica Andrews’ I Know Who I Am. Lee Greenwood’s I’m Proud to be an American. Lee Ann Womack’s I Hope You Dance.

Currently, it’s “Fatalism” by Massive Attack. Do you know that feeling you get when you’re alone at night, window open, and a light gust of wind drifts into your bedroom as you fold into your crisp sheets, and simply breath it all in? It’s almost like a sense of euphoria, and relaxation combined....That’s how this song makes me feel:
